$x_{1}$ is the daytime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a drama/play about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ with actors $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_2$ may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) in situation $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is something else.
elliptical/unspecified modal.
pro-sumti: elliptical/unspecified utterance variable.
generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener; elidable after COI.
pro-sumti: you the listener & others unspecified.
elidable terminator: end vocative (often elidable).
$x_1$ is a (topological) hole in object $x_2$
column3: Refers to a "hole" in the topological sense, i.e. one which goes all the way through an object, such as a hole in a sheet of paper. For non-topological holes (ones that do not go all the way through, such as a hole in the ground), use {kevna}. See also {canko}, {kalri}, {canlu}. Proposed rafsi -dol-

column2: $x1$ is medicine used to treat illness/disease $x2$ ({bilma}/ka/state) via mechanism of action $x3$ (event) at dosage $x4$ (ka))
column3: x1 is medicinal.  x4 is properly a period and an amount, e.g. "loka {milgra} li panono {reroi} ro le {djedi}", but may be abbreviated to either. See also {mikce}, {micyxu'i}, {farmako}, {bilma} Made with gismu[...]score.py iau ocydi dryg medisina lekarstvo daua

column2: $c_1$ is a second person pronoun in language $c_4$.
column6: 2nd person pronoun;pronoun for second person;second person pronoun

column2: $x_1$ talks to you (i.e. whoever $x_1$ is addressing) about $x_2$ in language $x_3$
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $x_{1}$ is the calendar day of event $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$
$x_1$ is a moon of planet $x_2$, visible from location $x_3$ on that planet, where it is daytime.
$x_1$ is a 'day-moon' event, a time when the moon is visible in daylight.
column3: A translation of the Turkish word günay (literally 'day-moon'), a common surname. From {donri}+{lunra}+{fasnu}.

column2: $m_1$ is the noon (midday) of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$b_1$ is later than noon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a lunch, dinner (midday meal) composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$c_1$ is diurnal/active during the daytime $d_1$.
$x_1$ is a butterfly
column3: A member of taxon Rhopalocera. See {toldi}, {cinki}

column2: $x_1$ is/reflects (North) Germanic Scandinavian (Norse-speaking) geography/language/culture in aspect $x_2$
$g_1$ is Germany.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of germanium (Ge).
$x_1$=$di_1$ is a theater for performing plays with theme $x_2$=$di_2$=$dr_2$ for audience $x_3$=$dr_4$ with actors $x_4$=$dr_5$.
$x1$=$k1$=$d5$ plays $x2$=$k2$ in play $x3$=$d1$

$x_1$=$d_1$=$k_1$ is a role-player / player of role playing game / RPG / LARP or dramatic / acting game $x_2$=$d_5$=$k_2$ about $x_3$=$d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4$=$d_3$ for audience $x_5$=$d_4$.
column3: Audience defaults to the players themselves.  See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracyselkei}.

column2: $x_1$=$d_1$=$sk_1$ is a role-playing game/ RPG/ LARP or dramatic/ acting game played by performer(s)/ player(s) $x_2$=$d_5$=$sk_2$ about $x_3$=$d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4$=$d_3$ for audience $x_5$=$d_4$ .
column3: Audience defaults to the players themselves.  See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracykei}.

column2: $g_1$ (event) corrects $g_2$ into $g_3$=$d_1$, correct in property/aspect $x_4$=$d_2$ (ka) in situation $x_5$=$d_3$ by standard $x_6$=$d_4$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) corrects $d_1$.
$x_1$ acts correctly in doing $x_2$; $x_1$ does the right thing
$x_1$ is depressive/has depressions
$x_1$ (agent) makes $x_2$ sad about $x_3$ (abstraction)
column3: Note that the English expression "(Poverty) makes me sad" is often really just "{se} {badri} mi". This word is for *causing* someone's sadness about something, e.g. a documentary making you feel sad about poverty.

column2: $x_1$ feels bittersweet about $x_2$ (event/state)
column3: Refers to an emotional/pensive state that is simultaneously pleasant and painful; see also {cinmo}, {pluja}, {tanjelavi}.

column2: $g_1$ comforts $j_1$=$b_1$ about $b_2$
$x_1$ is a dolmen
$x_1$ is a gazelle of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ reflects/pertains to Holy Roman Empire culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is/reflects (North) Germanic Scandinavian (Norse-speaking) geography/language/culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Germanic Scandinavian: Norwegian, Swedish, etc. See also: {no'ordo}, {ska'ando}.

column2: $x_1$ (ka) is/are the stage direction/s specific to actor/s $x_2$ of play $x_3$
$x_1$ is opera
$x_1$ is a dragon of species $x_2$
Germany (Deutschland)
Dresden.
Antarctic Ocean.
impersonal pronoun; generic-you; generic-one; a generalized person
gafyzmico: Reset all default specification of the immediately previous word to their respective discourse-external/official definition specifications for this instance/usage only.
column3: Resets all defaults (default specifications) in the (terbri) structure of immediately previously uttered word so that implicit/omitted {zo'e} and {di'au} that may fill the terbri of that word are predefined/specific in reference and do indeed necessarily agree with the default setting explicitly specified in the discourse-exterior/”official” definition of the word. The terbri are not filled by this word. Usage is only meaningful for a brivla with at least one terbri (regardless of being explicitly filled or otherwise). In a tanru or other complicated construct, only the most recent word undergoes this terbri default restoration (not every term in the construct). A selbri converted to a sumti by gadri has the x1 terbri filled for the purposes of this word, but the default setting of that terbri is so restored all the same; likewise is the case for terbri accessed by {be} or {bei}; seltau in the main level of a sumti are filled by the gadri as well for the purposes of this word. The restoration is only effective for the single occurrence/instant/usage of this word (the next use of the affected word will be implicitly accompanied by its terbri defaults, as defined elsewhere (by official definition or by other (permanent) modifications made to the word)). See also: {dau'a}, {de'oi}, {zmico}
column6: default reset (across all associated terbri);default restoration (across all associated terbri)

column2: audience switch marker.
column3: Indicates that the addressee has changed (even if no-one has ever been explicitly specified to have been an audience member); it does not specify who the new addressee is.

column2: generic vocative address to intended listener;.
$x_1$ is PA days in duration by standard $x_2$.
column3: Example "pu lo re doi'e" meaning "two days ago". See also {djedi}, {nei'o}, {lei'o}, {jei'o}, {coi'e}, {moi'e}, {soi'e}, {cei'a}.

column2: anti-vocative: specifically denies that the referent is the intended listener.
column3: *Note: Only accepted by experimental grammar* (u'u doinai la .djon.) = "Sorry, I wasn't talking to you, John". May also be used alone if the referent is obvious from context.

column2: $s_1$  is a Grüne Soße/german green sauce for use with $s_2$, containing ingredient(s) including $s_3$.
column3: Green Sauce is a specialty of the German state of Hesse.

column2: $d_1$=$b_1$ is the German used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$c_1$ is a book containing drama/play $c_2$=$d_1$ by book author $c_3$ to book’s audience $c_4$ preserved in medium $c_5$.
$x_1$ (ka) is/are the stage direction/s specific to actor/s $x_2$ of play $x_3$
$x_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is extremely/intensely sad/depressed about $x_2$=$d_2$ as measured/seen/observed by $x_2$=$c_3$.
column3: Composed of {badri}, {carmi}. The advantage of using "carmi" instead of {mutce} here is that {carmi} is subjectively determined by the carmi3, whereas {mutce} implies some kind of real, objective standards for measurements. {dritce} (based on {mutce}) is more appropriate for objectively determined states of depression.

column2: $x_1$ is a dorayaki made of material $x_2$
$x_1$ properly/diligently/earnestly/legitimately/by-the-book/"whole-assedly" satisfies or does $x_2$ (ka).
Doris
vocative: to the attention of, CC, carbon-copy(ing) ...
column3: Used in order to alert a non-addressee party to an utterance.

column2: Quotes a word; the result is a pro-sumti for the most recent utterance containing that word.
column3: A useful alternative to {di'u} {de'u} etc. that doesn't make you count utterances.

column2: generic single-word generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener with a single, possibly non-Lojban word, delimited by pauses (in speech) or by whitespace (in writing).
column3: The intent is that it is allowed everywhere in the grammar where DOI and COI are. See also {zo'oi}, {la'oi}, {me'oi}, {ra'oi}. Not similar to {co'oi}. Equivalent to {doi} {la'oi}.

column2: pro-sumti: the original speaker (= you the primary listener/target) and the rest of the audience, excluding the new/current speaker (= me).
column3: Used in reply to someone who was addressing an audience; this replies to them and the rest of the audience, but not the person who utters this word. This is a specifizing/narrowing of "{do'o}".
column6: you and the rest of the audience

column2: question word: which utterance?
column3: Parallels {do'i} and other cmavo from the {di'u} series. Answer can be a {di'u} cmavo or indeed any quote, usually a {lu} quote. See also {do'i}, {ma}.

column2: digit/number: twenty (decimal 20).
$x_1$ is the minor key of tonic $x_2$ of/with type/notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the major key of tonic $x_2$ of/with type/notes $x_3$.
$x_1$ is January in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$
$x_1$ is (a/some) krill [member of malacostracan crustacean order: Euphausiacea] of subtaxon/type/genus/species/variety/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a fiacre, a small hackney carriage
$x_1$ is a fiesta
vocative: \n{fi'i } - hospitality\n{fi'i nai} - inhospitality.
$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ is a current/flow/river of/in $x_{2}$ flowing in direction to/towards $x_{3}$ from direction/source $x_{4}$.
column3: [$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); $x_1$ flushes toward $x_3$; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
column3: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
column3: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
column3: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
column3: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
column3: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
column3: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
column3: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column3: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column3: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column3: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column3: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column3: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column3: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column3: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column3: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
column3: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column3: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_2$ by storyteller $x_3$ to audience $x_4$.
column3: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author.  See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
column3: Also roll, log.  ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
column3: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
column3: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the liver [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fuel/energy-source for powering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
column3: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
column3: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}).  See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column3: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column3: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column3: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column3: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column3: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
column3: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

column2: convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
column3: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
{klani} modal, 1st place (amount)                   quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
descriptor: the one, which (is / does) ... / those, which (are / do) ...
column3: Terminated with {ku}. Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

column2: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
discursive: ditto.
$x_1$ flirts with $x_2$ by doing $x_3$
$x_1$ is excited/feels excitement about $x_2$ (event/property); $x_2$ excites $x_1$

$x_1$ awaits for $x_2$ (event) with bated breath; $x_1$ waits for the occurrence of $x_2$ excitedly/restlessly; colloquially: $x_1$ just cannot wait for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ is eager for event $x_2$.
column3: The colloquial definition is figurative: the waiting must and will be performed, but $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to happen as soon as possible/to just come already- for time to flow faster. This is how a child feels on Christmas Eve night for Christmas Day. Usually positive; the negative version is essentially "dread". There should be a sense of longing (but future-oriented), intensity, and/or aching for what $x_1$ vaguely expects to happen (independent of what actually does end up happening). See also: {fizbu} (which lacks the sense of waiting), {denpa} (which lacks the sense of excitement and which has too many terbri). Proposed rafsi: "-fiz-".

column2: $x_1$ is (a) philosophy/ideology (one sense) about/of/pertaining to topic/subfield (one sense) $x_2$ with subfield (different sense)/features/details/specifics/specific idea(s) $x_3$, with methodology $x_4$, followed/thought/considered by $x_5$ (thinker/philosopher/individual); philosophy $x_1$ is characterized by values/thoughts/opinions/ruminations $x_3$ about topic/subject $x_2$.
column3: May also include code of conduct, ethical protocol, mode of thought, life-musings, etc.. x5 need not be an ardent supporter of the philosophy, although a certain degree of substance might be implied by the connection of being a philosophy (rather than a passing thought or idea) thereof; x5 does not need to be professional. Proposed short rafsi: -les-. See also: {pijyske}, {filsofiia}, {filsofo}, {marde}, {lijda}, {saske}, {jinvi}, {sidbo}, {pensi}, {prije}, {djuno}, {krici}, {menli}, {jijnu}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: *$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column3: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column3: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column3: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column3: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column3: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
column3: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column2: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$
column3: Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and 心 (romaji: kokoro).

column2: $x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development
$x_1$ pertains to Loglan language/culture in aspect $x_2$

$x_1$ is/pertains to/reflects some version of Loglan or Lojban, or the derivatives thereof (or any language, project, thing which is path-connected thereto by derivation), in aspect/property $x_2$ (ka).
column3: Not necessarily any logical language, but ones which are inspired by or based on Loglan or Lojban. This word is meant to make it so that "{loglo}"'s semantic scope can be narrowed so as to refer to Loglan, as opposed to/exclusive of Lojban and others; and likewise for "{lojbo}". See also: "{gaspo}".

column2: $x_1$ is a crustacean of order/family $x_2$

$x_1$ (person(s)) is/are adopted by $x_2$ (individual, family, tribe/clan, community, team, institution, etc.) into the latter's overarching family/clan/tribe/community/team/institution/etc. $x_4$ in(to) role/relation $x_3$ or an analog thereof via means/law/norm/socio-cultural or other mechanism $x_5$; $x_2$ adopts $x_1$ into $x_2$'s family11.
column3: $x_1$ is the adoptee; $x_2$ is the adopter. Usually (in modern Western culture), adoption of this type is of a young child ($x_2$) by a soon-to-be parental figure or romantic n-some ($x_1$) into the role of their offspring analog ($x_3$); however, many other forms of adoption are possible and belong to this word. Note that this definition is in the passive voice in English. The 'step-parent'/'step-child' or even direct spousal or resultant 'in-law' relationships may in some sense be viewed as adoption via marriage. This definition is very broad, but a certain degree of integration is assumed or required (at least for certain purposes). Adoption can be by a community and the 'familial' relationship can be simply a somewhat interpersonally-distant communal one. Adoption need not be by an older or more senior person of a younger or more junior one. $x_4$ is most useful when it differs from $x_2$ (particularly if $x_2$ is an individual). Adoption does not presuppose that no relationship, or even similar relationship, existed prior to the adoption, although it would be odd to adopt someone into exactly the same relationship which they already had attained. This word replaces the word "{lacpa}", which is prohibited by gismu conflict ({gimkamsmikezypro}); for a perfect synonym of zevla form, see: "{cplancu}".

column2: $x_1$ is electric [adjective] producing electric field $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
column3: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

column2: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
column3: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

column2: $x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
column3: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

column2: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
column3: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

column2: $t_2$ is the style (in the sense of art/fashion/creative work/object) of object $f_2$ by creator $f_3$ derived from existing elements/ideas $f_4$
$x_1$=$f_1$=$xa_1$ is Afro-Asiatic in aspect $x_2$=$f_2$=$xa_2$; $x_1$ is Africa and Asia considered together
$x_1$ pertains to African-American culture in aspect $x_2$.

column3: Hazel in this context is a brown and/or gold color that is mixed with or has a tint of green (or vice-versa). Really, only objects that have qualities similar to eye irises can be hazel; other combinations of brown and green do not necessarily constitute hazel (rather, they are often a muddy green or a mossy brown), but if the object has these qualities sufficiently, it may qualify. The point is that not all brown-greens are hazel. This color is distinct from amber.

column3: For example, a Gaussian has two tails; the tail with the greater numbers (which is traditionally/conventionally plotted on the right side of a horizontally oriented scale) is kamyzmakezra'a. For another example, suprema and infima are the bounds on a set; suprema are bounds from (so-called) above - in other words, from the numerically greater side of the set in question. This word is used for every reference of saying "above", "upper", or "right" in the context of ordered numbers, since these terms are culturally-dependent. See also: {kamymeckezra'a}.
column6: the greater end;the numerically higher end

column3: Includes 0 = (0,0) = 0 + 0i. This word relies on {xo'ei} implicitly filling the second slot of "{ka'o}" and also relies on the Cartesian decomposition of all complex numbers into real and imaginary bases (due to {ka'o}). It is important to note that this is isomorphic to a 'normal' real number but is not one; it is a complex number with imaginary part 0. See also: {ka'o zei namcu} and {nozeika'o zei namcu}.

column3: This is the transport phenomena sense of "flux": a density of flow, the maximal rate of flow of a subsramce or quantity ($x_2$) through a differential hypersurface. If the hypersurface $x_3$ is $n$-dimensional spatially and the dimensionality (units) of $x_2$ is $U$, then the dimensionality (units) of $x_1$ is $U$/(1 m$^{n}$ * s). Fairly similar to {nildenmi}. For the hypersurface integral of this quantity (with respect to the normal), use: {flaumji}. See also: {flecu}.

column3: A particular type of fast food restaurant, selling fries and usually a variety of other deep-fried snacks and sauces, as found in Belgium, the Netherlands and Northern France. The place structure models {gusta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a frustum/cone/cylinder/pyramid made of material $x_2$ with larger base $x_3$ and at-most-as-large base $x_4$, with other characteristics $x_5$.
column3: $x_4$ cannot be larger in hyperarea than $x_3$. A cone and a pyramid are degenerate frusta with exactly one base ($x_4$) being exactly a point (the apex); a line segment is a doubly-degenerate frustum with $x_3$ (and therefore $x_4$) being a point. The bases should typically be approximately parallel to one another; they need not be perpendicular to their axis. Except possibly when at least one base is a point, they will be (apprpximately) geometrically similar to one another (having the same cross-section along parallel planes wrt the axis, modulo scale/size, which will nonetheless be multiplied by a uniform factor in all 'dimensions'). A round base will produce, approximately, a circular cone or a (circular) cylinder.

column3: Inner structure of the rule: operator-1 (joik-jek operator-1 | joik stag? KE # operator /KEhE#/)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ (plural of ordered pairs) is an exhaustive set (possibly infinite) of inputs/outputs defining a unary function which yields result $x_3$ when given input $x_2$; $x_1$($x_2$) = $x_3$
column3: f(x) = z == "fy funtiio xy fi zy". "lo ro se {zilbri} be lo ka ce'u {sumji} ce'u li pa" is a way to extract the input/output set of the relation "f(x) = x−1", so that you can use it as funtiio's x1. Using a la-name for referring to a function is also an option, for example "la .fankcyn. cu funtiio li re li ci". See also {fancu}, {fancuka}.

Creates a predicate abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding all the necessary lambda variables to the ko'a-ko'u pronoun series. The number of bound variables must be indicated by appending {xi} followed by that number to the word {fo'ai}, unless only one variable (namely {fo'a}) is bound, in which case the {xi} marking is optional.
column3: lo ka ce'u ce'u ce'u broda (ku) = "fo'ai xi ci fo'a fo'e fo'i broda (ku'au)". In the rare cases where more than five lambda variables are needed, fo'a xi PA might be used. See also ko'ai, ce'ai.

column2: GOI attachment modifier: allows a cmavo of selma'o GOI (which must follow immediately) to be attached to a selbri
column3: This word must (ignoring quotes, etc.) be preceded by a selbri (to which it immediately attaches, even in sumti) and must be followed by a member of selma'o GOI (ignoring erasure, etc.). All other semantics and syntax of the GOI construct remains the same, it just applies to the selbri immediately prior to this word, rather than a sumti. See also: {po'oi}.

column2: create a relation abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding the two lambda variables to the {fo'i} and {fo'u} pronouns.
digit/number: first Foias' constant; the unique value of $x_1$ such that $x_n$  -> ∞ as n -> ∞ for $x_{n+1}  = (1 + (1/( x_n )))^n$; such $x_1$ = 1.187…
digit/number: second Foias constant; the value x for which $(1/x)(1 + (1/x))^x=1$ is true; ≈ 2.293…

discursive: 
{fu'au} - luckily
{fu'aucu'i} - not pertaining to luck
{fu'aunai} - unluckily.
column3: Expresses fortune/misfortune of the speaker. Use {dai} to express fortune/misfortune of the listener. See also {funca}.

column2: begin within-context quote.
column3: Terminated by {fu'o}. Quoted text need not be grammatical on its own, but must be grammatical in context with the surrounding text.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'e; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'i; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'o; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'u; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: $x_1$ is a fortepiano
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i } - easy\n{fu'i nai} - difficult.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
column3: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

column2: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column3: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
column3: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of $x_{2}$, gender $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].
column3: Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) $x_1$ is anal.  See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ organizes $x_{2}$ [relative chaos] into $x_{3}$ [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_3$ is also a system; $x_4$ could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of $x_3$.  See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_3$ includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a root [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing].
$x_{1}$ reflects Argentinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the grammar/rules/defining form of language $x_{2}$ for structure/text $x_{3}$.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
closed interval bracket marker; mod. intervals in non-logical connectives; include boundaries.
location tense relation/direction; upwards/up from ...
{gasnu} modal, 1st place agent/actor case tag       with active agent ...
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal and (with gi).
mathematical operator: null mathematical expression (mex) operator (used in >2-ary ops).
attitudinal: elliptical/unspecified/non-specific emotion; no particular feeling.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal connective question (with gi).
trinary mathematical operator: order of magnitude/value/base; [b * (c to the a power)].
shift letterals to Greek alphabet.
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$x_1$ is a galaxy, of contents $x_2$ and other characteristics/parameters $x_3$; $x_1$ is galactic.
$x_1$ is turned off / deactivated, not performing function $x_2$
$x_1$ is the sensory media content of type/stimulating sense/containing experience information $x_2$ of recording/broadcast/media $x_3$ displayed/produced by medium/device $x_4$.
column3: Generalizes/encompasses both of {vidvi} and {snavi} (where $x_2$ is visual/video or audio, respectively), so-called '4D' experiences (which have jostling/kinetoceptive and olfactory stimuli), the feelies from Huxley's /Brave New World/, and other stuff.

column2: $x_1$ pertains to Gua\spi language/culture in aspect $x_2$
$t_1$=$f_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rust.
$x_1$ is old enough to have responsibility $x_2$, according to standard $x_3$
$t_1$=$f1$ is a director/trustee on the board of directors/trustees of $f_2$.
$k_1$=$t_1$=$f_1$ is the board of directors/trustees of  $k_3$.
column6: board;board of directors;Board of Directors;board of trustees

column2: $x_1$ holds $x_2$ responsible for $x_3$ (event/action)
$b_1$ is a broom with bristles $b_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$j_1$ plays baseball against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$co_1$ is a mop/swab/swob for soaking up $ci_1$=$co_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) pole dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ using pole $g_1$.
$x_1$ is a truss for supporting $x_2$
$x_1$ is truss bridge a over/across $x_2$ between $x_3$ and $x_4$
$x_1$ is a popsicle with ice cream $x_2$=$b_1$=$l_1$ and stick $x_3$=$g_1$.
$x_1$ is a french-fried potato of variety/cultivar $x_2$ cooked in fat/oil $x_3$
$v_1$ is a grate between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of material $g_2$=$x_4$.
$b_1$ is a gas cylinder [closable container for gas] made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.
$x_1$=$d_1$=$g_2$ desublimates from the gaseous state at temperature $x_2$=$d_2$=$g_3$ with pressure $x_3$=$d_3$.
column3: The process of this is called “deposition” or “desublimation” in English. From “{gapci} {dunja}”; refers to a direct change of the state of matter from gaseous to solid. Cf. {ligyfebvi}.

column2: $g_1$=$z_1$ perceives $z_2$ to have quality $g_2$ by means/sense $g_3$=$z_3$ under conditions $g_4$=$z_4$
$x_1 = cuxna_3$ (set) is the collection of options/settings that can be chosen by user $x_2 = cuxna_1$ ~ $galfi_1$ for purpose $x_3$.
column3: cuxna2 is deleted; galfi1 was raised from an event abstraction to a person agent; the third sumti slot of this word is not predictable from veljvo (but is inspired by galfi2). x3 is the interface feature which the choices modify; for example, x3 can be the sound amplitude ('loudness') feature/setting on a speaker and x1 is a set of values for that feature (according to some scale) which can be achieved by the speaker output.

column2: $x_1$ (agent) causes $x_2$ (event) to modify/alter/change/transform/convert $x_3$ into $x_4$
column3: This is a {jvajvo}: {galfi} {zei} {gasnu}. Included in the dictionary because it's referenced in the notes for {galfi}.

column2: $x_1$=$z_1$=$g_1$ is a zmico that modifies the terbri default specification of a brivla, producing result $x_2$=$z_2$=$g_3$ at level/with construct-orientation $x_3$=$z_3$ with discourse duration $x_4$=$z_4$ in language $x_5$=$z_5$; $x_1$ is a default specification modifier that produces output re-specification $x_2$
column3: {zmico} is an experimental gismu. See also: {zmico}, {sumyzmico}

column2: $m_1$=$g_1$ is a cover/[lid/top] for sheltering $m_2$=$g_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$.
$m_1$ is a van for carrying $m_2$=$b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$
$gas_1$ puts cover $gac_1$ on $gac_2$.
$d_1$=$g_1$ is a flood covering $g_2$.
$v_1$ is a chest containing $v_2$=$g_2$ with lid $g_1$.
$g_1$=$b_1$ is a forearm of $b_2$.
$c_1$ looks up at $c_2$=$g_1$.

$x_1$=$c_1$ climbs/[goes up/ascends] upwards on wall/fence/mountain/boulder/obstacle $x_2$=$c_2$ using $x_3$=$c_4$ [limbs/tools/equipment] towards top/summit $x_4$=$g_1$ from base/floor/baseline/standard height $x_5$=$g_3$.
column3: From {galtu} {cpare}. Narrows down {cpare} to only mean climbing and upwards, against the gravitational pull (the frame or reference). For surface of x2, see/use {sefta}.

column2: $gas_1$ elevates/raises $gal_1$ by height reference $gal_2$ and height standard $gal_3$.
$x1$=$g1$=$j1$ sinks/descends in frame of reference $x2$=$g2$ by amount $x3$=$j3$
$g_1$=$j_1$ is the peak/summit of $j_2$ at location $j_3$ in frame of reference $g_2$
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {galtu}, {jipno}

column2: $m_1$ rises to $m_2$=$g_1$ from origin $m_3$=$g_3$ via path $m_4$.
$p_1$=$g_1$=$t_1$ is the top (uppermost part) of $p_2$.
$x_1$ is a harmonic/overtone of $x_2$; $x_1$ is otonal with respect to $x_2$.
column3: x1 and x2 can be frequencies, or pitch classes, or intervals. See also: {dzito'a}.

column2: $c_1$=$g_1$ is the lap of $t_2$.
$b_1$ is a/the maxilla bone performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$f_1$=$g_1$ is a/the pharynx [body-part] of $g_2$.
column3: Similar to pharanx (gr. cleft, chasm). Nasopharynx (={zbigalxyfe'a}), oropharynx (={molgalxyfe'a}), laryngopharynx/hypopharynx (={galxyferni'a}). See also {moldruji'o}, {galxe} and {fenra}.

column2: $g_1$=$p_1$ is the Adam's apple (laryngeal prominence) of $g_2$=$p_2$.
$x_1$ synaesthetizes qualia $x_2$ with qualia $x_3$ (but not necessarily the inverse) under conditions $x_4$.
column3: $x_2$ and $x_3$ are specific qualia (so, orangeness and spiceyness would work; but color and taste would not work). {ganseti} {srana}.

column2: $x_1$ is December/twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
column3: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {gai} (gam). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavrelma'i}

column2: $x_1$ is a dozen of $x_2$ counting by dimension/aspect $x_3$
$x_1$=$c_1$=$g_1$ is vast in dimension $x_2$=$g_2$ to observer $x_3$=$c_3$=$g_3$
$xa_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is a broadsword for use against $xa_2$=$d_2$ by $xa_3$ with blade of material $d_3$, long by standard $c_3$, broad by standard $g_3$.
$t_1$ is an ellipse (geometric form)  of object/abstraction/manifestation $t_2$ (object/abstract) wide in dimension $x_3$=$g_2$.
$z_1$ narrows/contracts/is diminished in dimension $g_2$ by amount $j_3$.
$x_1$ is a note low in frequency/pitch produced by $x_2$
column3: cf. {ganra}, {tonga}. See also {jakto'a} for "high-pitched".\n\n"wide" refers to the wavelength of a note low in frequency, as well as the characteristics of an object which produces such a note. Alternative to existing word {cmato'a}, which is ambiguous due to the fact that "small" could refer to either the frequency in Hertz (i.e., low pitch) or the wavelength (i.e. high pitch).

column2: $x_1$=$m_1$=$g_1$ measures $x_2$=$m_2$ meters in its second longest direction $x_3$=$m_3$=$g_2$ by measurement standard $x_4$=$m_4$.
column3: x1 {ganra} is not asserted, which is why ganra3 is absent. Cf. {clatre}, {tsutre}.

column2: $b_1$ is a steer [castrated male cattle/beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $b_2$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is a bullock [castrated old male cattle/beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $b_2$, old by standard $c_2$.
$d_1$ is a scrotum of $g_2$.
$z_1$ broadens/widens in dimension $g_2$ by amount $z_3$.

$t_1$=$g_1$=$r_1$ is an indehiscent fruit/seed-envelope (which remains closed/sealed and whole) of organism $t_2$ with potential to produce/containing/enclosing offspring $t_3$=$g_3$ preventing passage to $g_2$  (default: external environment)
column3: r2 is assumed to be indefinite (indehiscent fruit must be processed/stimulated by active external means in order to release their seeds). There is no reason for the 'fruit' to necessarily be of a plant, although it probably will be.

column2: $s_1$ is an affricate consonant with place of articulation $g_1$=$m_2$=$m_3$ and phonation $x_3$.
column3: cf. {zunsna}. Since this is a long lujvo, this word may possibly be reduced to {ce'osna} in fast speech and/or informal writing.

column2: $x1$=$gr1$=$ga3$ is a latch/[closing rod] of material $x2$=$gr2$, closing $x3$=$ga1$, preventing passage to $x4$=$ga2$
$gas_1$ shuts $gan_1$, preventing passage/access to $gan_2$ by $gan_3$.
$s_1$ is a plosive consonant with place of articulation $g_1$ and phonation $x_3$
$x1$=$k1$ ascends/goes up to $x2$=$g1$=$k2$ from $x3$=$g2$=$k3$ via route $x4$=$k4$ by means $x5$=$k5$.
$x_1$ is upside-down
$f_2$ is turned up from $g_2$ in reference frame $g_3$.
$b_1$=$g_1$ is a fence separating $b_2$=$g_2$ and $b_3$=$g_2$ (unordered) of/in structure $b_4$.
$x_1$ is obvious/easy to notice for $x_2$
column3: Additional sumti slots are probably needed. See also {jmifrili}.

column2: $k_1$=$g_3$ is a/are the whisker(s)/sensory hair(s) /vibrissa(e) attached to $k_2$=$g_1$ at body part $k_3$ for the detection of stimuli $g_2$ under conditions $g_4$.
$x1$=$s1$ feels $x2$=$g2$ to $x3$=$g1$=$s3$ under conditions $x4$=$g4$=$s4$
$n_1$ is a sensory neuron which carry input stimulus property $g_2$ (ka) to brain, of observer $g_1$=$n_2$
$x_1$ (thing/nu) feels sensory-good / is a pleasant stimulus to $x_2$
$x_1$ (event) is an illusion that deceives/tricks $x_2$ into sensing $x_3$ using sense $x_4$ under conditions x5
$x_1$=$j_1$ witnesses/testifies $x_2$=$j_2$ (du'u) about $x_3$=$j_3$ by epistemology $x_4$=$j_4$
$x_1$ is the sensori-motor stage as experienced by child $x_2$
column3: 1st stage in Jean Piaget's 4 stages of cognitive development. Between 0-2 years, a child discovers the difference between themselves and their environment. At that point, they will use their senses to learn.

column2: $x_1$ uses $x_2$ for bringing about $x_3$ (event)
$x_1$=$k_1$ is person/agent $x_2$=$g_1$'s reason/motivation/purpose for doing/bringing about $x_3$=$g_2$=$k_2$.
column3: From {gasnu} {krinu}. $x_1$ is by default known by $x_2$ at some level of consciousness; {nalsanji} {gaurki'u} may be used for when an agent's reasons for an act are truly unconscious.

column2: $t_1$ is an opportunity for $t_2$=$g_1$ to do $g_2$.
$x_1$ volitionally brings about $x_2$ (event) for purpose/goal $x_3$ (event)
$p_1$ is toilet paper.
$gl_1$ rims/performs anilingus on $gl_2$.
$gl_1$ (giver) has anal sex with $gl_2$=$ga_2$ (receiver).
$x_1$=$k_1$=$g_2$ farts, expelling gas $x_2$=$k_2$.
$k_1$=$g_1$ the committee for steering/organizing $g_2$ into $g_3$ by system/principle(s) $g_4$ of body/organization $k_3$.
$k_1$=$g_1$ cheers with sound $k_2$ about $g_2$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is a rhizome/rootstalk of plant/species $x_2$.
column3: From {genja} {stani}. See also {patlu}, {samcu}. For the Deleuzian philosophy-thing, see {flesrnrizoma}/{deLEZ. zei gejystani}.

column2: $x_1$ is happier than $x_2$ about $x_3$ by amount $x_4$
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $g_1$=$p_1$ is blissful about $g_2$=$p_2$ (event/state).
$d_1$ is grammatically correct in situation $d_3$ according to grammar $d_4$=$g_1$.
$s_1$ is a grammatical structure/syntax of text $s_2$=$g_3$ defined by the grammar $g_1$ of language $g_2$.
$x_1$ is grammatically incorrect in situation $x_2$ according to grammar $x_3$
$x_1$=$f_1$ parses text $x_2$=$g_3$=$f_3$ according to formal grammar $x_3$=$g_1$.
$x_1$=$c_1$ (parser/interpreter) produces formal result $x_2$=$c_2$ from symbolic/formal manipulation of text string $x_3$ according to rules $x_4$
$s_1$=$g_1$ is a morpheme/most basic grammatical subunit of word, meaning/causing $v_2$ in language $v_3$=$g_2$ for language/text $g_3$.
$x_1$=$c_1$=$g_1$ barks expressing  $x_2$=$c_3$.
$c_1$ is dog food for dogs $c_2$=$g_1$.
column3: See also pet food (={dalpe'odja}) and animal feed (={da'udja}).

column2: $k_1$ is the howl of a dog/canine of species $g_2$.
$z_1$ is a doghouse for dog $z_2$=$g_1$.
$s_1$=$g_1$ is a dog housed in nest $s_2$ of dog breed $g_2$.
$x_1$ is a voiceless labiodental fricative sound produced by $x_2$.
column6: F sound;voiceless labiodental fricative;voiceless labiodental fricative sound

column2: $x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'gek' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: SE? GA NAI? # | joik GI # | stag gik. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.
$x_1$ (ka) is the case (uppercase or lowercase) of letter $x_2$ in orthography $x_3$

$x_1$ (text, image, page element) is supra/aforementioned/previous/earlier/preceding/above/toward the top of the page/screen (flat and primarily two-dimensional display) relative to $x_2$ (text, image, page element) on page/screen/in work $x_3$ according to cultural convention $x_4$.
column3: Because text is usually read horizontally, this word could mean "to the left of" (for left-to-right writing) or "to the right of" (for right-to-left writing), as assessed on each given line; additionally, any horizontal direction within the plane of the display can contribute a nonzero component, so long as $x_1$ is also topward of $x_2$. For texts/writing systems which begin at the bottom of a page (according to physical orientation), then this word refers to that direction instead of the physical top of the page. In other words, this word always is oriented back along the writing/display which, by cultural convention, the user should have already consumed. Can refer to distinct prior pages. Essentially, the entire document is imagined as being displayed upon a single, arbitrarily-long, ordered screen which is wide enough to display at most a single word/character or element per line throughout; in this configuration, $x_1$ precedes and is perforce 'above' $x_2$. See also: "{balvidzita}" (opposite), "{galprurci zei farna}".

column2: $x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$
column3: Especially in the face of difficulty; "keeping up the fight". The place structure is like {gunka} or {zukte}.

column2: $x_1$ is a kumquat of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ feels sensation / qualia $x_2$ via sense $x_3$ (ka) // {ka'e gansetifri} = $x_1$ is sentient (able to feel subjective conscious experiences)
column3: $x_2$ is a {ganseti}-type. Proposed gismu form: {gelse}, with rafsi -ges- and -ge'e-. See {lifri}, {ganse}.

column2: $x_1$ is a surjective function from $x_2$ (domain) to $x_3$ (codomain).
column3: Every element of the codomain has at least one preimage under $x_1$. See also: "{ficystoraunju}".
